posts.post_content: Well, granted, countering an ability by forcing an opponent to pay colored mana is pretty darn effective. And since white is really not an artifact-using color (the few Esper cards excluded) this is pretty good. Unfortunately, its scope is so small that itmay never see the light of day.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: She was the first gold card I ever got, and my first legendary creature. I'm one of the select few that has ever attacked with her as a member of a band.

Posted By: eestlinc (2/27/2011 3:17:43 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
one of the earliest Artificer creatures in Magic. She was the armorer of Testuo Umezawa and has more backstory than one would expect from a card with no flavor text. Her picture isn't that noteworthy--the markings on her face are pretty neat, but the rather silly looking armor behind her takes up so much of the card that its hard to tell what Tanaka really looks like. I can't even tell if she has hair or clothes or not...It looks more appropriate for an instant or sorcery than a creature...especially if the creature is the person and not the armor. But she is an armorsmith so it makes sense. And the color sceme matches her colors.  
  
Her casting cost is pretty difficult to hit, having 2 colored mana symbols with no colorless or hybrid to help alleviate the burden. Statistically she is only a 2/2. She isn't black, nor an artifact, has no shroud or regeneration...so she is quite difficult to keep alive. Name a form of removal and she is most likely susceptible to it. She has bandi... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: GrimGorgonBC (8/4/2009 2:54:31 PM)
Rating:

@kitsunewarlock:

She has hair - it may be hard to make out if your copy of this card doesn't have sharp colors, but it's blocking part of the armor. She also has clothes, or at least a top. Note the difference in coloration between her shoulder and the other visable parts of her. Also note the shine on said shoulder, and the pale yellow edging where shoulder meets neck.

It would have been nice if she had an ability that helped you find and/or put into play artifacts instead of banding. But, all in all, not bad.

Posted By: Salient (8/26/2011 9:54:50 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
lawlz- thanks to Banding, this is the subversion of the Trope: 'Oracle Texts make old cards read much shorter and cleaner'. :p  
  
Her ability is very good, though if it could only have somehow stopped mana abilities, she would have briefly been an answer to opposing MOXEN. Now the question is, if she was exactly costed and P/T'd the way she is now, with that extra functionality of stopping artifact mana sources....would she still be played or not?  
  
  
I think not. 4 colored mana is still pretty rough, and she's completely counterable/destroyable.
posts.html:
lawlz- thanks to Banding, this is the subversion of the Trope: 'Oracle Texts make old cards read much shorter and cleaner'. :p

Now the question is, if she was exactly costed and P/T'd the way she is now, with that extra functionality of stopping artifact mana sources....would she still be played or not?


I think not. 4 colored mana is still pretty rough, and she's completely counterable/destroyable.
